ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Occurrence_placement is the specification of the placement of a , which is defined in its own coordinate space, in the coordinate space of a reference physical element.
The placement is established between a that represents the part occurrence and a that specifies a view of a version of the physical element.
Only specializations of Occurrence_placement can be instantiated.
The Physical_element_definition that represents a view of a version of the physical element.

The associated with the reference_organ, in which the placed part occurrence is located.
It shall contain instances associated with each part occurrence located with respect to the reference_organ.
It may contain additional instances of geometric entities, describing shape aspects relevant in the context of the reference_organ.
The associated with a reference_organ 'car engine' may contain instances locating the gear box and the crankshaft and additional geometric information representing the envelope box allowed for the car engine.
This shall be:
either associated through a with an instance of whose described_element attribute refers to the reference_organ and whose name is 'positioning',
or associated through a with an instance of whose described_element attribute refers to the reference_organ.

The or the that specifies the transformation of the geometric model of the shape of the placed part from its reference position to the position of the part occurrence in the reference_coordinate_space of the reference_organ. This transformation shall be an isometry.
The that is referred to, indirectly, by the positioned_representation attribute and which defines the local geometry of the part occurrence shall be associated with the through an instance of and of .
A Part_occurrence_placement is a type of Occurrence_placement that specifies the placement of a single part occurrence.
The that represents the part occurrence.

A Physical_element_placement is a type of Occurrence_placement that specifies the placement of an occurrence of a version of physical element. Positioning of the physical element 'steering wheel' depending on left hand versus right hand steering is an example of use of Physical_element_placement.

The that represents a view of a version of the placed physical element. The Physical_element_placement does not define the placement for all variants of the placed_organ with respect to the reference_organ.
The version of the placed_organ shall be distinct from the version of the reference_organ.
